item.title: About us
item.author: CamperForge
item.description:
For over a year, we have been working on our first game. During this time, we’ve also participated in several game jams to refine our skills and improve our teamwork.

We are developing our first game using Unreal Engine, working from our camper and occasionally from our home office.

Team Members

Miriam - Design

I love level design, and I hope you’ll soon get to see our upcoming game, into which we’ve poured a lot of effort and passion.


Ruben - Programming

I’ve been making video games for over 20 years, using all kinds of engines—both proprietary and commercial—for a wide range of platforms. For the first time, we’re doing it in our own indie studio. I hope that, together with Miriam, we can soon show you what we’ve been working on.


Nymeria - I do so many things that I wouldn’t know where to start…

The fluffiest and most energetic member of the team!

item.title: GameDev Challenge
item.author: CamperForge
item.description:
GameDev Challenge

We have been organizing this game jam for a couple of years, where we develop retro games for their respective platforms without using game engines or commercial tools—all within a single weekend.

You can check out our website here.

item.title: Gamejams
item.author: CamperForge
item.description:
Games

A list of the game jams we have participated in.


D.E.S.C.O.N.T.R.O.L - Playstation One (2023)

Developed during the GameDevChallenge

A local co-op game where players must manage suitcases moving along airport conveyor belts, detecting if any contain dangerous items. Interestingly, anaglyph cardboard glasses are used to hide information from the players.


Crazy Tetris - Unreal PC (2024)

Developed during the Cádiz - Lanzarote ferry trip, in 12 hours
